articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: They are facing longer dry spells, more erratic rainfall and rising input costs. They are also working to feed a growing population. They have to deal with it all at the same time. It's a big challenge.    for the world's farmers.

articles.title: How To Reach More People And Save Lives In The Climate Crisis
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Lives are at risk from not hearing warnings to prepare or evacuate from extreme weather in time, because the media they listen to does not believe in climate change. The media should be more aware of the fact that climate change is a real and serious threat to human lives.

articles.title: Summer 2024 was Lapland's warmest in 2,000 years: study
articles.author: RTE
articles.summary: The summer of 2024 was the warmest in 2,000 years in the Lapland region of northern Finland, Norway and Sweden, driven by climate change, according to Finnish Meteorological Institute. Last summer's average temperature was highest in both direct and indirect data.

articles.title: Rose water to Aloe Vera gel: 7 top Ayurveda secrets to save your eyes from ...
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: This year, the heatwave conditions have become a cause for concern as early as April, with temperatures rising above normal across many regions. Heatwaves are a common problem in India during the summer months, particularly from late April to June. They are more prominent in the northern, central and western parts of the country.

articles.title: Five ways to make cities more resilient to climate change
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Climate breakdown poses immense threats to global economies, societies and ecosystems. Many cities and countries remain chronically unprepared in what the UN calls an 'adaptation gap'. Building climate resilience is notoriously difficult, but it is necessary to adapt to the changing climate and build resilience to it.

articles.title: Loss of FEMA program spells disaster for hundreds of communities and their projects
articles.author: The Buffalo News
articles.summary: The Trump administration has eliminated a federal grant program to help communities prepare for natural disasters and climate change. It has affected hundreds of communities nationwide. The program was intended to help them prepare for climate change and natural disasters, but it has been eliminated by the Trump administration.

articles.title: Tropical mountain ice cores help decipher climate riddles in Earth's history
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Scientists are working to solve an enduring climate mystery. If solved, it could help them make more accurate predictions about the planet's future. Data from ice cores collected from Greenland, Antarctica suggests that the planet experienced an early, steady increase in warming throughout the Holocene.

articles.title: Open Forum: The loaves, the fishes, and a dying reef: Pope Francis and the moral call of climate justice
articles.author: NICK SNOW
articles.summary: As we warm the earth, the worst impact will be on the poor, as Pope Francis warned in his encyclical Laudato Si'. The poor are harmed most by economic disruptions of climate change. Fossil fuel companies have already caused $28 trillion in global heat-related damages by 2020. First Street expects U.S. real estate losses alone will be $1.47 trillion by 2055.

articles.author: China Daily

articles.title: Vanuatu Communities Growing Climate Resilience
articles.author: Scoop
articles.summary: Communities in Vanuatu are learning to grow climate resilient crops. Cyclone Lola devastated the country 18 months ago, but the crop production has improved since then.       .   in this video is from CNN iReport.com.

articles.title: Pakistan calls for global climate action to mitigate adverse impacts of climate change
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Musadik Masood Malik is Pakistan's Minister for Climate Change and Environmental Coordination. He calls for global solidarity and action to mitigate the adverse impact of climate change. He urges investment in resilient infrastructure, improved water management systems, enhanced disaster preparedness and promotion of climate-smart agriculture.
